intro: Pasania tephrocarpa, commonly known as the ash-leafed pasania, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Pasania tephrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
